Text:
This is a poor rip.  Fully one third of the picture is taken up by black bars left and right.  The picture quality is DVD quality while the file size is enormous.

There is no HD version of Viva Zapata!  This is just an upscale, followed by a badly done encode.  Instead of downloading over 9GB you could get exactly the same quality (or maybe a little better because no middleman doing an encode) by watching the retail DVD9 or iso.

Screenshots, full size:  http://img191.imageshack.us/img191/8286/shot0001zr.jpg

http://img534.imageshack.us/img534/8420/shot0004vz.jpg
Of course its a HDTV...or u can't read the tag

Yes I can read the tag.  Some HDTV are genuine HD streams, some are only DVD streams upscaled.  And whatever the stream there is no reason to have 33% of the picture black bars; this is a very elementary mistake.

The quality looks good.

The seeding looks bad.
